I'm sharing the piano chords with you so that you can transcribe it to guitar or 
do whatever you want with it. This goes all the way up to the first guitar solo so 
it should help you if you just want to play the entire song.

Song Name: Boulevard of Broken Dreams
Artist Name: Green Day

This is a simplified version of the song that is played using 4 Main Chords and 1 
Additional Chord at the end of each chorus. The additional chord is B7, though you 
can play E7 instead if you find B7 too hard to play for now.

This is recommended for beginner guitarist to practice and learn the song before 
moving to more advanced chord progressions and styling.

Transpose Up 1 half steps using the Ultimate-Guitar transposing tool to change the 
chords below so you can play with the original Green Day version without a capo.

Alternatively Capo the 1st fret and use the chords below to play with the original

Artist: David Bowie

Tabbed by DJ ('DiddyD' at ultimateGuitar.com)
15th Oct 2016

Video of David playing this live on TV in the 1960's:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RRCKPAHUorI

Please IGNORE ANY POP-UP CHORD BOXES the website
might suggest, and use the typed shapes shown below:

Notes on the additional chords:
The Fmaj7#11 gives more of a flavour of the studio
version, David just played an Fmaj7 on the clip.
The F6 to F is suggested by the original Stylophone riff,
but David just played an F. The Cadd9 is suggested by
the melody, David just stayed on the C.

The break and coda is the Fmaj7 chord shape just moved
up the neck
